docs.lead_paragraph: The drug makers like the Baucus plan. They should -- they helped create it.

headline.main: Baucus Plan Pleases Drug Makers, but Not Other Groups
headline.print_headline: Baucus Plan Pleases Drug Makers, but Not Other Groups

docs.snippet: The drug makers like the Baucus plan. They should -- they helped create it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Earlier this year, after the Senate Finance Committee and the White House asked health industry groups to make concessions to help pay for a health care overhaul, only two groups ultimately came through. One, the drug industry, offered $80 billion over 10 years, while the other, hospitals, offered $155 billion.

headline.main: Baucus Plan Pleases Drug Makers, but Not Other Groups

docs.abstract: The drug makers like the Baucus plan. They should -- they helped create it.
docs.snippet: The drug makers like the Baucus plan. They should -- they helped create it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Update | The press conference has ended. Our coverage is below.Senator Max Baucus, Democrat of Montana, this morning released a proposal for overhauling the health care system, the result of more than a year of preparation and more than three months of intense negotiations between a small group of Democrats and Republicans on the Senate Finance Committee.
docs.abstract: Senator Max Baucus hosts a press conference to discuss the Senate Finance Committee's bipartisan proposal to overhaul the health care system.
docs.snippet: Senator Max Baucus hosts a press conference to discuss the Senate Finance Committee's bipartisan proposal to overhaul the health care system.

docs.lead_paragraph: How does a former mayor and famous foodie celebrate a successful quadruple heart bypass? At Peter Luger Steak House, of course.

headline.main: To Celebrate Recovery, Koch Invites Doctors to Eat

docs.abstract: Former Mayor Edward I. Koch, who had a successful quadruple bypass, has invited the 20 doctors who treated him and their spouses to Peter Luger Steak House to dine as his guests.
docs.snippet: Former Mayor Edward I. Koch, who had a successful quadruple bypass, has invited the 20 doctors who treated him and their spouses to Peter Luger Steak House to dine as his guests.

headline.main: Baucus Releases Senate Health Care Proposal

docs.abstract: Senator Max Baucus offers up his long-awaited plan for a health care overhaul.
docs.snippet: Senator Max Baucus offers up his long-awaited plan for a health care overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: UPDATE | 9:42 a.m. Senator Baucus's office has just released a copy of his bipartisan proposal. Read it here (pdf).

headline.main: Updated: Baucus's Bipartisan Bid Is Set Back, But Not Necessarily Over

docs.abstract: Senator Charles E. Grassley says he's in no hurry to support a Democratic bill, but there is still time for deal-making.
docs.snippet: Senator Charles E. Grassley says he's in no hurry to support a Democratic bill, but there is still time for deal-making.

docs.lead_paragraph: Update | 3:56 p.m. An earlier version of this article said that 8.4 million people watched "60 Minutes" on Sunday night, but that was the audience from 7-8 P.M., which included 20 minutes of tennis; updated figures for "60 Minutes" itself, which aired from 7:28 to 8:28, put the audience at 10.5 million. ---

headline.main: With Sunday TV Push, Obama Is Raising the Health Care Ante

docs.abstract: Planning a whirlwind round of talk shows is further evidence Obama is staking his main domestic agenda on his powers of personal persuasion.
